News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Will LLMs Get Us To AGI?
| A16Z | YouTube.com | October 13, 2025
Vishal Misra, a renowned computer science professor at Columbia, explores the potential of large language models (LLMs) to drive scientific breakthroughs and their limitations in achieving true artificial general intelligence (AGI). The conversation delves into the mechanics of reasoning, the impact of entropy on prediction, and the defining attributes of AGI.
B.)
How To Edit Images With Nano Banana In Search
| Blog.google | October 13, 2025
Google is rolling out a new image editing model called Nano Banana, allowing users to transform photos through Lens and AI Mode. This feature, available in the Google app, enables users to create, edit, and share images easily with suggested prompts and the option to use existing images.
C.)
‚ÄòGPT-6 Will Be Significantly Better‚Äô: Sam Altman On What Openai Learned From Rocky GPT-5 Launch
| IndianExpress.com | October 13, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed confidence that the upcoming GPT-6 will vastly outperform its predecessor, GPT-5, which faced criticism for failing to meet user expectations. He highlighted that improvements would stem from using advanced techniques rather than simply increasing training data and processing power.
D.)
Police Are Asking Kids To Stop Pulling AI Homeless Man Prank
| TheVerge.com | October 12, 2025
A viral prank involving AI-generated images of a homeless man has led to increased anxiety among parents and unnecessary calls to law enforcement, as a number of children send fabricated images to their parents claiming to have let a stranger into their home. Police warn that this prank can result in serious consequences, including SWAT responses, as it misleads authorities who may treat the situation as a genuine emergency.
E.)
Slack Upgrades Slackbot With New AI Assistant Features For Enhanced Productivity And User Support
| TheVerge.com | October 13, 2025
The revamped Slackbot acts more like an AI companion that can help you create plans, schedule meetings, find files, and more.
October 21, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | October 21, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
October 20, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
Andrej Karpathy Devastates AI Optimists‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 20, 2025
Andrej Karpathy challenges prevailing beliefs within the AI community, delivering a compelling critique of overly optimistic views surrounding artificial intelligence‚Äôs capabilities. This discussion dives deep into the misconceptions and raises critical questions about the future of AI development.
6.)
Claude Code On The Web
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 20, 2025
Claude Code on the web enables users to assign coding tasks directly from their browsers, leveraging Anthropic‚Äôs advanced cloud infrastructure. This innovative platform is ideal for addressing bug backlogs, implementing routine fixes, or facilitating parallel development workflows.
7.)
How AbbVie Accelerates Drug Discovery With Claude
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 20, 2025
Sarah Nam, VP of AI Strategy and Partnerships at AbbVie, teams up with Anthropic‚Äôs Ivy Weng to outline AbbVie‚Äôs innovative use of AI in transforming pharmaceutical research. Key insights include leveraging Claude for Life Sciences to enhance drug discovery through advanced data analysis and optimizing clinical trials.
8.)
Introducing Claude For Life Sciences
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 20, 2025
Jonah Cool and Eric Kauderer-Abrams from Anthropic unveil their vision for Claude as the pivotal AI research assistant for life sciences. They explore Claude‚Äôs capabilities in bioinformatics analysis and report generation, alongside strategic partnerships that seamlessly integrate with existing scientific workflows.
9.)
Reid Hoffman On AI, Consciousness, And The Future Of Labor
| a16z | YouTube.com | October 20, 2025
Reid Hoffman, a key figure in major tech evolutions, examines the impacts of artificial intelligence on work, science, and human identity. Joining Erik Torenberg and Alex Rampell, they explore AI‚Äôs potential for human advancement, the importance of reasoning in AI systems, and the innovative design required to support, rather than supplant, human capabilities.
10.)
Scaling Enterprise AI: Fireside Chat With Eli Lilly‚Äôs Diogo Rau And Dario Amodei
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 20, 2025
Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic, engages with Diogo Rau, Chief Information and Digital Officer at Eli Lilly, to explore advancements in enterprise AI within regulated sectors such as life sciences. The conversation highlights Lilly‚Äôs innovative AI strategies for clinical research and the development of industry-specific AI models, reflecting a commitment to reliability and steerability in technology deployment.
11.)
Deepseek Unveils OCR System To Help AI Process Much Longer Image-Based Text Documents
| The-Decoder.com | October 20, 2025
Chinese AI company Deepseek has built an OCR system that compresses image-based text documents for language models, aiming to let AI handle much longer contexts without running into memory limits. The main idea is that processing text as an image can use less compute than working with the digital text itself. According to Deepseek‚Äôs technical paper, their OCR can compress text by up to a factor of ten while keeping 97 percent of the original information.
12.)
Friend AI Faces NYC Protest As Public Dismantles Device Cut-Out And Chants For Real Connections
| TheVerge.com | October 20, 2025
People tore apart a cutout of the device while chanting ‚Äòget real friends.‚Äô
13.)
Kohler Unveils Toilet With Built-In Camera To Deliver Health Insights From Bathroom Habits
| TheVerge.com | October 20, 2025
Dekoda is a health tracker that analyzes what‚Äôs in your toilet to assess your hydration and gut health.
14.)
Anthropic Unveils New Claude Features To Boost Life Sciences Research And Drug Discovery Performance
| Anthropic.com | October 20, 2025
Increasing the rate of scientific progress is a core part of Anthropic‚Äôs public benefit mission. We are focused on building the tools to allow researchers to make new discoveries ‚Äì and eventually, to allow AI models to make these discoveries autonomously.
15.)
The Web Is Revolting Against AI Scrapers
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 20, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs recent claims about GPT-5 solving previously unsolved mathematical problems sparked controversy, leading to clarifications that the problems were not genuinely unsolved. Meanwhile, Wikipedia faces an 8% drop in traffic, attributed to AI summaries minimizing user clicks, igniting a revolt among content creators against the use of their work without proper attribution.
16.)
AI News Anchor Debuts On U.K.‚Äôs Channel 4 In Stunt Proving Dangers Of Artificial Intelligence
| Variety.com | October 20, 2025
Channel 4‚Äôs documentary ‚ÄúWill AI Take My Job?‚Äù features a fully AI-generated news anchor, stirring discussions on the impacts of AI on employment. The initiative highlights concerns regarding AI‚Äôs potential to disrupt industries while reinforcing the importance of authentic journalism.
17.)
Trump Reposts AI-Generated Video Of Plane Dumping Sludge On No Kings Protesters
| TheGuardian.com | October 20, 2025
Donald Trump reposted a satirical AI-generated video depicting him dumping sludge on No Kings protesters. This video mocked the protests against his presidency that took place across the U.S., while musician Kenny Loggins expressed his disapproval of the unauthorized use of his song in the clip.
October 19, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
18.)
Andrej Karpathy‚Äôs AGI Prediction
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 19, 2025
Andrej Karpathy predicts that advancements toward Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) will take another decade, highlighting significant limitations in current AI technologies. He emphasizes the necessity to shift focus from automated AI solutions to augmented intelligence for meaningful progress in the next ten years.
19.)
X To Replace Heuristic Algorithms With Fully AI-Driven Grok Recommendation System In Coming Weeks
| Perplexity.ai | October 19, 2025
X will eliminate all heuristic-based algorithms and transition to a fully AI-driven recommendation system powered by Grok within the next four to six weeks, Elon Musk announced Thursday. The sweeping change represents the platform‚Äôs most significant algorithmic overhaul since Musk acquired it, promising to revolutionize how content is discovered and distributed across the social media platform.
October 18, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
20.)
AI News: GPT-6 2025, NVIDIA DGX-1, Claude Skills, Waymo DDOS, Datacenters in Space, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 18, 2025
Explore the latest advancements in AI technology, featuring insights on the future release of GPT-6, the capabilities of NVIDIA‚Äôs DGX-1, and new functionalities in Claude. The discussion extends to cybersecurity in autonomous vehicles and the innovative concept of datacenters operating in space, paving the way for future technological landscapes.
21.)
Veo 3.1 Proves AI Video Isn‚Äôt Slowing Down
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | October 18, 2025
Veo 3.1 introduces exciting new features, showcasing the rapid advancements in AI video generation with some remarkable outcomes. Viewers are invited to explore innovative tools, including a limited-time offer for Warp Pro with Al credits to maximize their creative potential.
22.)
AI Safety In 35 Minutes
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | October 18, 2025
AI Safety is crucial in ensuring the responsible development and deployment of artificial intelligence systems. This crash course provides insights into AI safety frameworks, risks, and practical measures to mitigate issues like bias and data poisoning, aimed at developers, researchers, and anyone interested in AI.
23.)
Google AI Studio Launches Updates Offering Developers Greater Control Over Their Projects
| Blog.google | October 18, 2025
Google AI Studio has new updates that give you even more control ‚Äî and make it easier to just focus on building.
October 17, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
24.)
Building More Effective AI Agents
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
In this insightful discussion, Anthropic‚Äôs Alex Albert engages with Erik Schluntz to explore the advancements in AI agents over the past six months. Key topics include the development of multi-agent systems, effective patterns, and essential best practices for utilizing agent skills and MCP servers.
25.)
Can Quantum Gravity Be Created in the Lab? | Podcast: The Joy of Why
| Quanta Magazine | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Physicist Monika Schleier-Smith introduces her groundbreaking experimental methods using laser-cooled atoms to investigate the relationship between quantum entanglement and gravity. This episode of ‚ÄúThe Joy of Why‚Äù provides insights into the quest to reconcile quantum mechanics and gravitational theory, exploring new frontiers in scientific understanding.
26.)
Claude Can Learn Anything Now & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Igor delves into the latest AI advancements, highlighting significant updates including improvements in ChatGPT, a new emotionally intelligent voice model, and innovative tools that enhance automation processes. Each of these developments aims to empower users with practical, cutting-edge applications in the AI landscape.
27.)
Marc Andreessen On The State Of Film And Hollywood
| a16z | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Marc Andreessen joins Erik Torenberg and Katherine Boyle to explore the shifts in Hollywood‚Äôs cultural landscape and the filmmaking industry over the last decade. The discussion covers the significance of storytelling, the impact of AI on creativity, and the resurgence of humor and genuine art in film.
28.)
OpenAI Codex In Your Code Editor
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Gabriel Peal and Romain Huet demonstrate how to enhance your coding experience using OpenAI Codex within popular code editors like VS Code and Cursor. Techniques showcased include code exploration, feature implementation, and design brainstorming, revealing substantial changes to Gabriel‚Äôs workflow for improved productivity.
29.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Curvy Road to AGI Includes Sora 2 and‚Ä¶ Erotica??
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
OpenAI reveals upcoming capabilities of ChatGPT, including adult AI conversations, while also updating Sora 2. Meanwhile, Google demonstrates significant advancements in AI technology, notably in cancer research and video modeling, enhancing our understanding of AI‚Äôs potential impacts on various fields.
30.)
Space With ChatGPT
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Explore how to create an effective study environment with the assistance of ChatGPT. Insights include tips on finding the perfect location and establishing a productive study routine to maximize learning outcomes.
31.)
20 Ways To Use ChatGPT Like The Top 1%
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Explore powerful techniques that elevate ChatGPT usage from a basic chatbot to an essential business partner. Gain insights on maximizing its potential with practical applications designed to enhance productivity and decision-making in your daily work.
32.)
Andrej Karpathy ‚Äî ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Summoning Ghosts, Not Building Animals‚Äù
| Dwarkesh Patel | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Andrej Karpathy delves into the complexities of artificial general intelligence, asserting that current methodologies are flawed. He discusses the long journey toward self-driving technology, the challenges of reinforcement learning, and predicts the future landscape of education as it intersects with these advancements.
33.)
Anthropic Founder Warns The World Of What‚Äôs Coming‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 17, 2025
Insights from the founder of Anthropic shed light on the imminent future shaped by advanced artificial intelligence technologies. The discussion emphasizes the ethical implications and societal changes expected in a rapidly evolving technological landscape.
34.)
AI For Science Is Getting Real
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 17, 2025
AI advancements are significantly influencing physical sciences, with prominent developments in cancer research and fusion energy. Google DeepMind‚Äôs latest model predicted a new approach to cancer therapy, while partnerships between AI firms and research institutions aim to unlock breakthroughs in scientific fields.
35.)
Facebook Launches AI Feature To Suggest Your Best Photos And Videos For Sharing From Camera Roll
| DigitalTrends.com | October 17, 2025
Facebook is giving you a smarter way to choose what to post by using AI to scan your camera roll.
36.)
Meshy Unveils Meshy 6 Preview, The First AI-Powered 3D Modeling Platform With Sculpting-Level Features
| TechBullion.com | October 17, 2025
Meshy.ai, the #1 AI-powered 3D modeling platform in the world, today unveiled Meshy 6 Preview, a game-changing breakthrough that pushes AI-generated content into an entirely new dimension. With over 40 million models generated and 5 million creators onboarded globally, Meshy is not just participating in the 3D revolution ‚Äî it‚Äôs leading it.
37.)
Nvidia Drives Open Source AI Growth As Chinese Labs Rapidly Advance In Large Language Models
| AIWorld.eu | October 17, 2025
Just two years ago, most AI developers relied on closed, proprietary systems ‚Äì especially for large language models (LLMs). Today, the landscape has flipped. Whether for text, image, audio, video, or fully multimodal tasks, a growing ecosystem of open models is evolving rapidly. On Hugging Face alone, over one million new repositories have appeared in the past 90 days. Making AI technologies openly available is key to building reliable tools and democratising their development: researchers and SMEs can adapt datasets and models without fearing that their tech stack will be deprecated or locked behind paywalls.
October 16, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
38.)
Claude Skills: Specialized Capabilities You Can Customize
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 16, 2025
Claude harnesses specialized Skills to perform tailored tasks effectively, from designing presentations to adhering to brand guidelines. By integrating multiple Skills, Claude showcases innovative capabilities, allowing users to create unique and customized content seamlessly.
39.)
Connect Claude to Microsoft 365
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 16, 2025
Integrating Claude with Microsoft 365 through the MCP connector enhances productivity by streamlining access to SharePoint, Outlook, and Teams. Users can efficiently search files, analyze email threads, and gain insights to tackle complex problems, enabling swift and informed decision-making.
40.)
Creating Custom Skills With Claude
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 16, 2025
Claude demonstrates how to build innovative custom skills using the skill-creator Skill, showcasing the creation of an image editing capability. This guide empowers users to harness their creativity for tailored workflows without the need for manual file modifications, making it accessible to various user tiers including Pro, Max, Team, and Enterprise.
41.)
Is Qwen‚Äôs New Image Model The Best?
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | October 16, 2025
The potential of Qwen‚Äôs new image model is explored, focusing on its features and performance in comparison to existing solutions in the AI landscape. Expert insights highlight its capabilities and how it may redefine image processing technology.
42.)
Keith Rabois: Israel, OpenAI, Opendoor, and DOGE
| a16z | YouTube.com | October 16, 2025
In a compelling dialogue, Keith Rabois articulates his vision for America‚Äôs forthcoming decade, centered on an economic expansion fueled by AI, productivity, and sovereign technology. Topics include the potential of AI to enhance GDP growth, the evolution of legacy institutions, and the prospects for major tech players like OpenAI and Google.
43.)
Veo 3.1 Is More Powerful Than You Realize!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | October 16, 2025
Google‚Äôs launch of Veo 3.1 introduces significant enhancements including richer audio, scene extensions, and context-aware object inserts, reshaping the landscape of video creation. Additionally, the Sora Storyboard update allows for streamlined workflows, making it easier to achieve cinematic results with powerful new tools.
44.)
New AI Models: Introducing Veo 3.1 And Claude Haiku 4.5
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 16, 2025
Google has launched Veo 3.1, featuring significant enhancements for video generation with a 50% price cut, while Anthropic released Claude Haiku 4.5, which offers competitive coding performance at one-third the price. Both models are positioned to compete within the rapidly evolving AI landscape as companies strive to make advanced AI technologies more accessible.
45.)
Bubble Unveils AI Agent To Integrate Conversational Coding With Visual App Development Tools
| SiliconAngle.com | October 16, 2025
Artificial intelligence visual development platform company Bubble Group Inc. today announced the launch of Bubble AI Agent, a new product that allows users to build production-grade applications by dragging and dropping elements in the platform‚Äôs editor or making changes conversationally.
46.)
Spotify Partners With Major Record Labels To Launch Artist-Focused AI Music Tools And Protections
| TechCrunch.com | October 16, 2025
Spotify on Thursday announced a series of deals with major record labels to develop new AI products designed to ensure fair compensation and center artists and songwriters in the experience. In partnership with Sony, Universal, Warner, and Merlin, the streamer said it would develop ‚Äúresponsible AI‚Äù products that not only respect copyright, but also allow the artists to choose whether they want to allow the use of AI tools.
47.)
Pinterest Lets Users Limit AI-Generated Content In Feeds With New Controls And Clearer AI Labels
| TechCrunch.com | October 16, 2025
Following backlash over an increase in ‚ÄúAI slop‚Äù taking over users‚Äô feeds, Pinterest on Thursday added new tools that let users limit how much AI-generated content they see on the platform.
48.)
New York Bans AI-Powered Rent Price Fixing Software, Targeting Companies Using Artificial Intelligence
| TheVerge.com | October 16, 2025
It‚Äôs the first statewide ban on algorithms designed to drive up rent.
49.)
Cisco Launches Project Codeguard, Open-Source Framework To Secure AI-Written Software
| SiliconAngle.com | October 16, 2025
Cisco Systems Inc. today unveiled a new open-source framework aimed at hardening software written with the help of artificial intelligence coding agents.
50.)
Amazon Unveils First Look At New Nuclear Facility To Boost Carbon-Free Energy Production
| TheVerge.com | October 16, 2025
The company wants to help develop next-generation nuclear reactors as a way of securing more carbon-free energy.
51.)
OpenAI Halts Sora Video Generation Of Martin Luther King Jr. After Request From King‚Äôs Estate
| TechCrunch.com | October 16, 2025
OpenAI announced Thursday it paused the ability for users to generate videos resembling the late civil rights activist Martin Luther King Jr. using its AI video model, Sora. The company says it‚Äôs adding this safeguard at the request of Dr. King‚Äôs estate after some Sora users generated ‚Äúdisrespectful depictions‚Äù of his image.
52.)
Microsoft Brings Copilot AI Features To All Windows 11 PCs With Latest Update
| Blogs.windows.com | October 16, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre taking an exciting step forward with a new wave of updates that make every Windows 11 PC an AI PC ‚Äì with Copilot at the center of it all. We are making the most powerful AI more accessible by integrating it into the Windows experiences people are already using every day.
53.)
Google Deepmind Partners With Commonwealth Fusion To Advance Fusion Energy Using AI Systems
| Deepmind.google | October 16, 2025
We‚Äôre partnering with Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS) to bring clean, safe, limitless fusion energy closer to reality. Fusion, the process that powers the sun, promises clean, abundant energy without long-lived radioactive waste. Making it work here on Earth means keeping an ionized gas, known as plasma, stable at temperatures over 100 million degrees Celsius ‚Äî all within a fusion energy machine‚Äôs limits. This is a highly complex physics problem that we‚Äôre working to solve with artificial intelligence (AI).
54.)
Character.AI Launches Scenes Feature For All Users, Enabling Immersive Storytelling And Role-Play
| Blog.character.ai | October 16, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre excited to announce that we‚Äôve unlocked Scenes Creation for all users! Scenes are short, Character-driven role-play moments that turn simple chats into immersive story-driven worlds. This immersive storytelling feature enables users to explore and create ready-made worlds, allowing them to step into them, making storytelling faster, deeper, and more accessible.
55.)
Anthropic‚Äôs Claude Now Integrates With Microsoft 365, Adds Enterprise Search Across Productivity Tools
| Anthropic.com | October 16, 2025
Claude now integrates with Microsoft 365 and offers enterprise search across your connected tools. Claude works with the productivity tools you use every day, bringing context from your documents, emails, and calendar directly into your conversations. Spend less time gathering information and more time on the decisions and work that drive impact.
56.)
Anthropic Launches Claude Skills To Let Users Build Custom AI Tasks Across Claude.ai, API, And Code
| Anthropic.com | October 16, 2025
Claude can now use Skills to improve how it performs specific tasks. Skills are folders that include instructions, scripts, and resources that Claude can load when needed.
October 15, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
57.)
Ben Horowitz and Ali Ghodsi: How to Run a $100 Billion Business
| a16z | YouTube.com | October 15, 2025
Ben Horowitz and Ali Ghodsi share invaluable insights on building and scaling a high-value business in this episode of ‚ÄúBoss Talk.‚Äù They delve into hiring practices, maintaining a strong company culture, navigating crises, and elevating ambition, drawing from their rich experiences as founders and leaders in the tech industry.
58.)
Introducing Claude Haiku 4.5
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | October 15, 2025
Claude Haiku 4.5 is revolutionizing coding with enhanced speed and affordability, delivering performance levels that rival its predecessor at a fraction of the cost. Experience rapid prototyping and streamlined development, as showcased by the creation of a dark mode toggle for a food delivery app in just under sixty seconds.
59.)
MCP In 26 Minutes (Model Context Protocol)
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | October 15, 2025
Explore the fundamentals and applications of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) with insights on server implementation and development approaches. This comprehensive guide offers both coding and no-code strategies for MCP server construction, empowering viewers to leverage AI in their projects.
60.)
NVIDIA‚Äôs Kari Briski on How to Use NVIDIA Nemotron Open-Source AI
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | October 15, 2025
Kari Briski, NVIDIA‚Äôs VP of Generative AI, details the capabilities and advantages of NVIDIA Nemotron, an open-source AI model that operates locally on personal hardware. This interview covers essential hardware requirements, deployment methods, and how developers can leverage Nemotron for secure and efficient AI solutions without cloud reliance.
61.)
Top 15 Mind Blowing Gadgets That‚Äôll Make You Feel Like You‚Äôre in 2030
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | October 15, 2025
Experience the future today with innovative gadgets that blend AI, robotics, and augmented reality. These groundbreaking technologies not only showcase the extraordinary possibilities of human creativity but also challenge our understanding of reality, enticing tech enthusiasts and casual viewers alike to imagine what lies ahead.
62.)
We Need To Talk About Sora 2
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | October 15, 2025
An exploration of the meteoric rise and subsequent decline of Sora 2, analyzing its innovative approach to AI technology compared to competitors like Meta Vibes. The discussion covers varied perspectives on AI‚Äôs impact on creativity and content, questioning whether it enriches the creative landscape or overwhelms audiences with low-quality material.
63.)
AI Designed Viruses To Kill Bacteria?!
| TheNeuronDaily.com | October 15, 2025
Stanford scientists have successfully used AI to design viruses that can kill bacteria, achieving a breakthrough in combating antibiotic resistance. The AI generated 302 virus designs, with 16 proving effective in lab tests against E. coli, marking a significant advancement in the development of viral treatments.
64.)
OpenAI Enhances Sora 2 With Storyboards For Pro Users And Extended Video Generation Limits
| X.Com | October 15, 2025
Storyboards are now available on web to Pro users. All users can now generate videos up to 15 seconds on app and web, Pro users up to 25 seconds on web.
65.)
Spotify AI DJ Now Accepts Text Commands And Spanish Voice Requests For Music Selections
| TechCrunch.com | October 15, 2025
Spotify on Wednesday upgraded its AI DJ feature ‚Äî available to Premium subscribers ‚Äî with a handful of new features, including the ability to send in your requests by typing, not just using voice commands.
66.)
Anthropic Launches Claude Haiku 4.5, Its Latest Small AI Model, Now Available To All Users
| Anthropic.com | October 15, 2025
Claude Haiku 4.5, our latest small model, is available today to all users. What was recently at the frontier is now cheaper and faster. Five months ago, Claude Sonnet 4 was a state-of-the-art model. Today, Claude Haiku 4.5 gives you similar levels of coding performance but at one-third the cost and more than twice the speed.
67.)
Apple Upgrades Vision Pro With M5 Chip, Dual Knit Band, And New Features In VisionOS 26
| Apple.com | October 15, 2025
The latest version improves performance, display rendering, battery life, and comfort, while offering innovative features with visionOS 26 and all-new spatial apps and Apple Immersive content.
68.)
Apple Launches M5 Chip, Delivering Major AI Performance Boost For Apple Silicon
| Apple.com | October 15, 2025
M5 delivers over 4x the peak GPU compute performance for AI compared to M4, featuring a next-generation GPU with a Neural Accelerator in each core, a more powerful CPU, a faster Neural Engine, and higher unified memory bandwidth.
69.)

Microsoft Launches Excytin-Bench To Benchmark AI Performance In Real-World Cybersecurity Tasks
| Microsoft.com | October 14, 2025
ExCyTIn-Bench is Microsoft‚Äôs newest open-source benchmarking tool designed to evaluate how well AI systems perform real-world cybersecurity investigations.1 It helps business leaders assess language models by simulating realistic cyberthreat scenarios and providing clear, actionable insights into how those tools reason through complex problems. In contrast to previous benchmarks that concentrated on threat intelligence trivia or static knowledge, this benchmark evaluates AI agents in multistep, data-rich, multistage cyberattack scenarios within a simulated security operations center (SOC) in Microsoft Azure.
